case_title: AURANGZEB, SUBDIVISIONAL EDUCATION OFFICER, SWABI vs ISTIKHAR ALI

summary.complaint_allegations: Respondent, a P.T.C. Teacher, practiced law while drawing salary from the Education Department without permission, violating professional conduct under the Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973.
summary.respondent_defense: Respondent denied allegations, claimed he was not enrolled as an Advocate and termed the complaint as malicious.
summary.tribunal_findings: Respondent was not enrolled as an Advocate on the roll of N.-W.F.P. Bar Council, thus the Tribunal lacked jurisdiction. Complaint returned to complainant for presentation before the proper forum.

legal_references.primary_statute: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973
legal_references.rules_referenced: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1976
legal_references.jurisdiction_section: Section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973

decision.jurisdiction: Tribunal lacks jurisdiction as respondent is not enrolled as an Advocate.
decision.action: Complaint returned to complainant for presentation before the proper forum.
